name: University of Ibadan
address: University Road, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria
description: Nigeria's premier university, established in 1948. The University of Ibadan is renowned for its academic excellence, beautiful campus, and rich history. It's home to the famous Trenchard Hall and houses one of Africa's largest university libraries.
imageAlt: University of Ibadan main entrance gate with lush greenery

name: Cocoa House
description: A 26-storey skyscraper and iconic landmark of Ibadan, built in 1965. Known as the first skyscraper in tropical Africa, it was funded by cocoa export revenues and symbolizes the economic prosperity of the Western Region.
imageAlt: Cocoa House towering over Ibadan skyline

name: Mapo Hall
address: Mapo Hill, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria
description: Historic town hall built in 1929, serving as the seat of the Ibadan Native Authority. This colonial-era building offers panoramic views of Ibadan and is a symbol of the city's administrative heritage and cultural significance.
imageAlt: Historic Mapo Hall building on the hill overlooking Ibadan

name: Agodi Gardens
address: Agodi GRA, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria
description: A beautiful recreational park and zoo featuring lush gardens, a lake, children's playground, and various wildlife. Perfect for family outings, picnics, and nature lovers seeking tranquility within the bustling city.
imageAlt: Serene lake and gardens at Agodi Gardens with families enjoying recreational activities

name: National Museum Ibadan
address: PMB 5116, University of Ibadan, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria
description: Houses an extensive collection of Nigerian artifacts, traditional art, and archaeological findings. The museum showcases the rich cultural heritage of Nigeria with exhibits on traditional crafts, ancient kingdoms, and historical artifacts.
imageAlt: Traditional Nigerian artifacts and sculptures displayed at National Museum Ibadan

name: Trans Wonderland Amusement Park
address: Liberty Road, Challenge, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria
description: Nigeria's premier amusement park featuring thrilling rides, water attractions, and family entertainment. With roller coasters, water slides, and various recreational facilities, it's a perfect destination for adventure and fun.
imageAlt: Colorful roller coaster and water slides at Trans Wonderland Amusement Park

name: Bower Memorial Tower
address: Oke Are, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria
description: A 60-foot tall tower built in 1936 to commemorate Captain Robert Lister Bower, the first British Resident of Ibadan. The tower offers spectacular 360-degree views of the ancient city and surrounding hills.
imageAlt: Bower Memorial Tower standing tall against blue sky with city views

name: Ibadan Golf Club
address: Jericho GRA, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria
description: Established in 1932, one of Nigeria's oldest golf clubs featuring an 18-hole championship course. Set in beautiful surroundings with mature trees and well-maintained greens, it's a haven for golf enthusiasts and business networking.
imageAlt: Well-maintained golf course with lush green fairways at Ibadan Golf Club
